longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Nationals of St. Vincent and the Grenadines holding a
  driver's licence, Voter's Registration Card, social security
  card or National ID Cards (SEE NOTE 243). 
    NOTE 243: Identification cards must carry photograph and
   state nationality. If nationality is not indicated, ID card
   must be accompanied by a Birth Certificate and the
   information must be consistent with that of the ID card. 
- Holders of machine-readable (ICAO 9303 compliant) emergency
  and temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 6 months for
nationals of St. Vincent and the Grenadines.
Additional Information:
- Visitors must hold proof of sufficient funds to cover their
  stay. 
- Extension of stay possible for a max. stay of 6 months, for
  nationals of St. Vincent and the Grenadines. 
Warning:
- Passengers who have visited Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone
  within the last 21 days will be refused entry. 
- Nationals and alien residents of Antigua and Barbuda who
  have visited Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone after 15
  October 2014 may be subject to screening and health checks.
  Passengers may be quarantined for further assessment. 
- Visitors must hold return/onward tickets
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission if not leaving the transit area.
